overview: Hearing Devices and Rehabilitation B is a year-long subject that builds on the knowledge and clinical skills obtained in first year. This clinical subject focuses on adopting a holistic approach to hearing rehabilitation in adults with a hearing impairment. Theoretical knowledge will include emerging technological advancements in hearing devices, complex cases, advanced verification procedures and evidence-based practices in adult hearing rehabilitation.

The subject is part of the clinical placement program. Students should be expected to be allocated to clinical placements at the University Clinic and across metropolitan and rural services including hospitals and community settings.
intended learning outcomes: Conduct advanced hearing aid verification for individuals with complex hearing impairments;
Adapt communication to suit the needs of all patients;
Analyse, interpret, and integrate available information to recommend appropriate management and intervention options/strategies from the available clinical information
Demonstrate analytical skills by incorporating the theoretical principles of clinical decision making
Critically appraise marketing material and available evidence to inform clinical practice

necessary pre-requisite: For students completing 1st Year prior to 2021
additional pre-requisite: For students completing 1st Year from 2021 onwards

assessments.description: Written hearing devices and rehabilitation assignment. 1500 words
Clinical exam (simulated patient and oral exam). 2000 words (equivalent). Hurdle requirement:. Students must pass the Clinical Exam to pass the subject

Clinical portfolio and oral presentation. 500 words (equivalent). Hurdle requirement:. Students must complete all components of the e-portfolio to a satisfactory standard (50% mark) and pass the oral presentation to pass the assessment.
Written exam. 2 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Students must pass the exam to pass the subject

Year Long.Contact hours: Lectures and Practical Sessions: 40 hours. Clinics: 70 hours.

Recommended texts and other resources: Hearing Aids2nd Edition, Dillon, H., 2012, Boomerang Press (Thieme)
